alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 6:11PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Somerset, southern Worcester and northern Accomack Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 611 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Deal Island, or 11 miles southwest of Princess Anne, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pocomoke City, Princess Anne, Snow Hill, Westover, Deal Island, West Pocomoke, Marion Station, Horntown, Cokesbury, Goodwill, Greenbackville, Kingston, Shelltown, Cedartown, Mount Wesley, Beaver Dam, Whitesburg, Boxiron, Oriole and Public Landing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Virginia.
